trans-unit.source: Represents the collection of `<identityConfiguration>` elements in a configuration file.
A configuration file can have multiple `<identityConfiguration>` elements.
Each identity configuration is identified by a unique name specified in its `name` attribute.
Each `<identityConfiguration>` element is represented by an <xref:System.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityConfigurationElement> object.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityConfigurationElement.Name> property of each object contains the name of the identity configuration.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityConfigurationElementCollection> class wraps a collection that contains all of the `<identityConfiguration>` elements read from the file.

The name of the identity configuration is used as a key to retrieve the corresponding <xref:System.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityConfigurationElement> when you call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityConfigurationElementCollection.GetElement%2A> method.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityConfigurationElementCollection"></xref> class.
Retrieves the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityConfigurationElement"></xref> that has the specified name.
The name of the identityConfiguration element to retrieve.
This corresponds to the value of the elementâ€™s <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityConfigurationElement.Name"></xref> property.
The `<identityConfiguration>` element that has the specified name, or `null` if no matching element is found.
The default configuration was specified in the name parameter and a matching <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityConfigurationElement"></xref> could not be found.
